title: Isolating u
text: First, to isolate u, we can multiply both sides of the inequality by $$\frac{5}{4}$$. Since $$\frac{5}{4}>0$$, we don't need to flip the inequality sign. Hence, we get $$u>-25$$.
speech: First, to isolate u, we can multiply both sides of the inequality by  5 fourths . Since  5 fourths is greater than, 0 , we don't need to flip the inequality sign. Hence, we get  u, is greater than negative 25 .

title: Graphing on the Number Line
text: Next, graph the solution on the number line. To do this, shade to the right of $$-25$$ and put a parenthesis at $$-25$$.
speech: Next, graph the solution on the number line. To do this, shade to the right of  minus 25  and put a parenthesis at  negative 25 .
pacedSpeech: Next, graph the solution on the number line. To do this, shade to the right of   minus 25
and put a parenthesis at   negative 25

title: Interval Notation: Parentheses and Brackets
text: In interval notation, parentheses show that the endpoint of the inequality is not included. For example, the expression "x>3" includes all numbers greater than $$3$$. Since $$3$$ is not included in the solution, the interval notation is $$(3,\infty)$$. Since $$\infty$$ represents "infinity" and is not an actual number, we always put a parenthesis next to $$\infty$$.
speech: In interval notation, parentheses show that the endpoint of the inequality is not included. For example, the expression "x>3" includes all numbers greater than  3 . Since  3  is not included in the solution, the interval notation is , the open interval from 3 to infinity, . Since  infinity  represents "infinity" and is not an actual number, we always put a parenthesis next to  infinity .
